NOTICE_DATA.n2016:PERFORMANCE_NUTS: Lochaber, Skye & Lochalsh, Arran & Cumbrae and Argyll & Bute
NOTICE_DATA.n2016:TENDERER_NUTS: Inverness & Nairn and Moray, Badenoch & Strathspey

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C03

TITLE.P: Harvest and Extraction to Roadside — Central and South Scotland, West Argyll, and Moray and Aberdeenshire

SHORT_DESCR.P: In order to achieve our harvesting programme, income targets and to supply Forestry Commission customers via Long Term Contracts and sales events held throughout the year, the Forestry Commission require to have in place several Medium Term Contracts (MTCs) for the provision of harvesting and extraction to roadside for Galloway, Dumfries and Borders, Scottish Lowlands, Cowal and Trossachs, Tay, West Argyll, and Moray and Aberdeenshire Forest Districts.

MAIN_SITE.P: Various sites across the West Argyll Forest District

SHORT_DESCR.P: In order to achieve our harvesting programme, income targets and to supply Forestry Commission customers via Long Term Contracts and sales events held throughout the year, the Forestry Commission require to put in place a Medium Term Contract for the provision of harvesting and extraction to roadside for various coupes within the West Argyll Forest District. This includes a requirement to comply with various FISA, FMOTC, NPTC, Health and Safety, and Forestry Commission standards (or equivalents) all of which can be obtained by accessing the Invitation to Tender on the PCST electronic tendering system.

INFO_ADD.P: Economic operators may be excluded from this competition if they are in any of the situations referred to in regulation 58 of the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015.

Should any question within the ESPD be subject to pass/fail scoring to be scored ‘fail’ the entire bid shall be set aside and shall take no further part in the competition.
Question Scoring Methodology for Award Criteria outlined in invitation to tender:
0 — Unacceptable — Nil or inadequate response. Fails to demonstrate an ability to meet the requirement.

25 — Poor — Response is partially relevant and poor. The response addresses some elements of the requirement but contains insufficient/limited detail or explanation to demonstrate how the requirement will be fulfilled.
50 — Acceptable — Response is relevant and acceptable. The response addresses a broad understanding of the requirement but may lack details on how the requirement will be fulfilled in certain areas.
75 — Good — Response is relevant and good. The response is sufficiently detailed to demonstrate a good understanding and provides details on how the requirements will be fulfilled.

100 — Excellent — Response is completely relevant and excellent overall. The response is comprehensive, unambiguous and demonstrates a thorough understanding of the requirement and provides details of how the requirement will be met in full.

Tenderers who are successful in being named as preferred bidders following evaluation of their tender submissions will then be requested to supply evidence of minimum requirements as requested in the European Single Procurement Document. Preferred Bidders will have 5 working days to submit these documents.
The buyer is using PCS-Tender to conduct this ITT exercise. The Project code is 9165. For more information see:
http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2343

Tenderers should note that although the total value of the Contract has been estimated at 23 570 000 GBP (excl. VAT) the FC may modify the Contract, irrespective of the monetary value of those modifications, within the scope permitted as allowed under Regulation 72 (1) of The Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015, should Operational reasons require it.
Actual requirements can vary due to changes in (for example);
— Changes to Market Conditions,
— Coupe Conditions,
— Statutory Plant Health Notices (SPHN) which could result in a.
Time bound requirement to clear areas of forest.
Community Benefits.
Allan Moffat Forestry.

A community benefit will form part of the contractual agreement. This annual contribution towards a community activity has been agreed and identified as the Galloway Fisheries Trust. The aim of the Galloway fisheries trust is to restore and maintain aquatic biodiversity, particularly native fish, in Galloway by mean of practical, responsible and sustainable approaches to land, water and fishery management, based on sound science, for the benefit of the community as a whole.
The Galloway Fisheries Trust is an environmental charity which was set up in 1988 by four local District Salmon Fisheries Boards in the South West of Scotland with common problems and aims.
National Indicator Outcome – L51.
Elliot Henderson Limited.

A community benefit will form part of the contractual agreement. This annual contribution towards a community activity has been agreed and identified as the Galloway Mountain Rescue. I confirm that Elliot Henderson if going to give his charitable donation to Galloway Mountain Rescue.

Galloway MRT provide search and rescue services in Dumfries and Galloway and South Ayrshire. They are a team of highly trained volunteers operating from a base in Newton Stewart. They hold charitable status and rely on public support. They are a Scottish Incorporated Organisation (SCIO) — Charity Number SCO20065 and rely upon the generosity of the public, local businesses and other organisations to finance the maintenance of equipment and regular training programmes within Galloway Forest Park.
National Indicator Outcome F47.
